title: Would You Like CREAM With Your TEA?
body_text:
TRONOLONE vs. LETSCHE in S17 MidSeason Showdown:
The Stakes Never Higher!
Perhaps no confrontation over the last 11 months had produced such raw emotion and physical intensity the likes of which felt and experienced at this career-jeopardizing war. Self-professed "Creation"
John Tronolone's
passion, desire, and most importantly captaincy were put to the test while rivaling general -
*wink-wink*
best buddy
Ryan Letsche
- attempted to save face both literally and figuratively. The six-week war of words had finally ceased; put up or shut up for this pair of dodgeball superpowers!
Both leading captains immediately took the fight to each other in the opening contest. Their supporting players, a slew of established heavyhitters, could easily sense the sick violence this collision was sure to entail. By the end of the first round, Letsche was one-up on his rival captain. Tronolone's initial downfall would only continue too, putting further pressure on he and his closest allies. The "Rimshot King" had advanced to 2 and 0.
Then the boxing gloves were ripped off.
The match-altering third proved to be the pivotal turning point. Tronolone refused to lie in the grave alive and was able to mount a solid counterstrike against his supposed "brother from another mother". The quick-witted, sideline specialties from DiBuccio coupled with the dynamite tandem "Punter" Wolf and Kevin Fitzpatrick's impactful power maneuvers catapulted the "Creation" ahead 3 to 2. The forthcoming "sadistic sixth" would make or break Letsche.
By this point, the two-hour war shifted over to the dark and grim front battlegrounds, but it was the inclusion of Prison Ball that nearly-atomic bombed Tronolone into near surrender. The cannons from southpaw Megill, fierce attacks from Teitelbaum, and the merciless chopping-down of enemies by "The Axe" Adams may have forced the "Creation" to raise the white flag had the beatings persisted. Something, or someone, had to give in the finale.
The raging fire within despite such physical and mental anguish had yet to die down. After an inconclusive six brutal battles, the veteran chiefs acknowledged that they and they
alone
would have to settle this damn thing mano-e-mano. With weapons stockers positioned and the combatants themselves equipped, it was go time.
The seesaw one-on-one climax electrified spectators each eager to witness first-hand their heroic general come out victorious. The single, fatal blow came in attempt to rearm and reload, with both adversaries' backs turned. But it was Tronolone who jumped through the window of opportunity first, rifling his last instrument of destruction into his unsuspecting nemesis's right leg. "The Creation" collapsed to the ground in a sigh of relief knowing that in that one second he had prevented his legacy from permanent termination.
Flash Results by Game
Letsche: 1, 2, 6
Tronolone: 3, 4, 5, 7*
Battle Royal champions. Rimshot Contest victors. Multi-time Season Finale headliners. Two of the all-time greats and a pair of lifelong buddies putting it all on the line for the world to see. What a match.
And for one John Tronolone, an end result like this tasted ever-so sweet!
The Rules
: Classic two-team match-up with standard rules in Games 1 to 5, Prison Ball in Game 6, and the one-on-one tiebreaker* in Round 7.
The Match
: John Tronolone defeated Ryan Letsche, 3(1) - 3, in a double stipulation
White Flag-CREAMation
match. The victory prevented Tronolone from captaincy retirement. This was the ninth overall
CREAMation Rules
match and only the third
White Flag
match.
Captains Statistics
: Tronolone 7-8-0 / Letsche 4-7-0
Tronolone
: first person to captain a team 15 times; first person to compete in a singles captains match 11 times; has won all of his 2008 matches, three of the four competed under the
White Flag
stipulation; along with Letsche, first person to compete in three separate
CREAMation
encounters.
Letsche
: has the second most number of total losses with 7, one shy of Tronolone; along with Tronolone, first person to compete in three separate
CREAMation
encounters; first loss in a
CREAMation
encounter.
Moments & Stars
: Jon Yochum's game-saving rimshot in Game 1; Ryan Letsche unintentionally kicking a bulletball into cousin Bobby Vetrano's face during the tiebreaker; Melissa Kerr on the receiving end of two Wolf-thrown bulletballs to the head; Jon Yochum wisely outfitted in pillows and blankets to protect himself from both the cold weather and stinging pain of the bulletballs
Attendance
: 19, comprised of 14 men and 5 women. This was the fourth consecutive event attendance fell below 20.
Familiar Faces
:
ECD
framer - Captain Letsche's girlfriend - Kimmy Canzanella participated after several weeks of inactivity.
Other Notes
: This was the first event to include both
White Flag
and
CREAMation Rules
stipulations. For a third time in
ECD
history, both front and back courts saw action. CLX5 also played host to just the second one-on-one tiebreaker ever
(see
DODGEBALL 105
)
. Also noteworthy was the absence of the tennis nets.
How's This For Dedication!
The temperature was a brutally low 23 degrees.
The Ingredients!
Two cans of whipped-cream were used during the
CREAMation
of one Ryan Letsche: one vanilla and one chocolate.
Online Exclusive!
In the 24 hours leading up to their heated match-up, both John Tronolone and Ryan Letsche engaged in several nasty phone conversations and traded lengthy voicemails in an effort to worry and scare the other. The instigative Tronolone even went as far as mouthing off to Letsche's innocent girlfriend Kimmy Canzanella! No wonder the match!
White Flag
History:
DODGEBALL CXLIX
..
DODGEBALL 154: 3 Year Anniversary
CREAMation
History
(Letsche Only)
:
DODGEBALL 125
..
DODGEBALL CXXX9
________________________________________
_____________
Season 17: Second Half!
New Start Time 6:30pm
!
DODGEBALL 166: Thanksgiving Special on 11/29!
The long-awaited
DODGEBALL C30
return match.
Chris Adams
clashes with
Kevin Megill
- give thanks indeed!
DODGEBALL 167 on 12/6!
A rivalry of this magnitude must go one more before year's end. Team
WALL
collides with Team
ALL
in the amazing tenth war!
DODGEBALL 168 on 12/13!
*Match Pending
DODGEBALL 169: 3rd Annual Holiday Special on 12/20!
From one pair of pals to another. Legendary figures
Kevin Fitzpatrick
faces
Justin Wolf
- Santa's come early this year!
DODGEBALL 170: Season 17 Finale on 12/27!
The culmination of a year's journey. Official announcement of this earth-shaking encounter to be made at DODGEBALL 166! Special start time of
5:45pm
is in effect!
body_html:
TRONOLONE vs. LETSCHE in S17 MidSeason Showdown:
The Stakes Never Higher!

Perhaps no confrontation over the last 11 months had produced such raw emotion and physical intensity the likes of which felt and experienced at this career-jeopardizing war. Self-professed "Creation" John Tronolone's passion, desire, and most importantly captaincy were put to the test while rivaling general - *wink-wink* best buddy Ryan Letsche - attempted to save face both literally and figuratively. The six-week war of words had finally ceased; put up or shut up for this pair of dodgeball superpowers!

Both leading captains immediately took the fight to each other in the opening contest. Their supporting players, a slew of established heavyhitters, could easily sense the sick violence this collision was sure to entail. By the end of the first round, Letsche was one-up on his rival captain. Tronolone's initial downfall would only continue too, putting further pressure on he and his closest allies. The "Rimshot King" had advanced to 2 and 0.

Then the boxing gloves were ripped off.

The match-altering third proved to be the pivotal turning point. Tronolone refused to lie in the grave alive and was able to mount a solid counterstrike against his supposed "brother from another mother". The quick-witted, sideline specialties from DiBuccio coupled with the dynamite tandem "Punter" Wolf and Kevin Fitzpatrick's impactful power maneuvers catapulted the "Creation" ahead 3 to 2. The forthcoming "sadistic sixth" would make or break Letsche.

By this point, the two-hour war shifted over to the dark and grim front battlegrounds, but it was the inclusion of Prison Ball that nearly-atomic bombed Tronolone into near surrender. The cannons from southpaw Megill, fierce attacks from Teitelbaum, and the merciless chopping-down of enemies by "The Axe" Adams may have forced the "Creation" to raise the white flag had the beatings persisted. Something, or someone, had to give in the finale.

The raging fire within despite such physical and mental anguish had yet to die down. After an inconclusive six brutal battles, the veteran chiefs acknowledged that they and they alone would have to settle this damn thing mano-e-mano. With weapons stockers positioned and the combatants themselves equipped, it was go time.

The seesaw one-on-one climax electrified spectators each eager to witness first-hand their heroic general come out victorious. The single, fatal blow came in attempt to rearm and reload, with both adversaries' backs turned. But it was Tronolone who jumped through the window of opportunity first, rifling his last instrument of destruction into his unsuspecting nemesis's right leg. "The Creation" collapsed to the ground in a sigh of relief knowing that in that one second he had prevented his legacy from permanent termination.

Flash Results by Game
Letsche: 1, 2, 6
Tronolone: 3, 4, 5, 7*

Battle Royal champions. Rimshot Contest victors. Multi-time Season Finale headliners. Two of the all-time greats and a pair of lifelong buddies putting it all on the line for the world to see. What a match.

And for one John Tronolone, an end result like this tasted ever-so sweet!

The Rules: Classic two-team match-up with standard rules in Games 1 to 5, Prison Ball in Game 6, and the one-on-one tiebreaker* in Round 7.
The Match: John Tronolone defeated Ryan Letsche, 3(1) - 3, in a double stipulation White Flag-CREAMation match. The victory prevented Tronolone from captaincy retirement. This was the ninth overall CREAMation Rules match and only the third White Flag match.
Captains Statistics: Tronolone 7-8-0 / Letsche 4-7-0
Tronolone: first person to captain a team 15 times; first person to compete in a singles captains match 11 times; has won all of his 2008 matches, three of the four competed under the White Flag stipulation; along with Letsche, first person to compete in three separate CREAMation encounters.
Letsche: has the second most number of total losses with 7, one shy of Tronolone; along with Tronolone, first person to compete in three separate CREAMation encounters; first loss in a CREAMation encounter.
Moments & Stars: Jon Yochum's game-saving rimshot in Game 1; Ryan Letsche unintentionally kicking a bulletball into cousin Bobby Vetrano's face during the tiebreaker; Melissa Kerr on the receiving end of two Wolf-thrown bulletballs to the head; Jon Yochum wisely outfitted in pillows and blankets to protect himself from both the cold weather and stinging pain of the bulletballs
Attendance: 19, comprised of 14 men and 5 women. This was the fourth consecutive event attendance fell below 20.
Familiar Faces: ECD framer - Captain Letsche's girlfriend - Kimmy Canzanella participated after several weeks of inactivity.
Other Notes: This was the first event to include both White Flag and CREAMation Rules stipulations. For a third time in ECD history, both front and back courts saw action. CLX5 also played host to just the second one-on-one tiebreaker ever (see DODGEBALL 105). Also noteworthy was the absence of the tennis nets.

How's This For Dedication!
The temperature was a brutally low 23 degrees.

The Ingredients!
Two cans of whipped-cream were used during the CREAMation of one Ryan Letsche: one vanilla and one chocolate.

Online Exclusive!
In the 24 hours leading up to their heated match-up, both John Tronolone and Ryan Letsche engaged in several nasty phone conversations and traded lengthy voicemails in an effort to worry and scare the other. The instigative Tronolone even went as far as mouthing off to Letsche's innocent girlfriend Kimmy Canzanella! No wonder the match!

White Flag History: DODGEBALL CXLIX .. DODGEBALL 154: 3 Year Anniversary
CREAMation History (Letsche Only): DODGEBALL 125 .. DODGEBALL CXXX9

_____________________________________________________

The long-awaited DODGEBALL C30 return match. Chris Adams clashes with Kevin Megill - give thanks indeed!

From one pair of pals to another. Legendary figures Kevin Fitzpatrick faces Justin Wolf - Santa's come early this year!

The culmination of a year's journey. Official announcement of this earth-shaking encounter to be made at DODGEBALL 166! Special start time of 5:45pm is in effect!
